topic: Cognitive Load in the Classroom: Design Principles That Actually Help Students Learn
target_audience: teachers and instructional designers; advanced students optimizing self-instruction

refs.content: Updates CLT; clarifies intrinsic/extraneous/germane load and design implications (worked examples, modality, redundancy).
Methods to manage working-memory load for complex tasks; concrete tactics for reducing extraneous load.
Load reduction instruction correlates with academic motivation and engagement in HS cohorts.

special_instructions: Turn principles into checklists (split-attention, signaling, modality, worked examples). Include classroom vignettes and pitfalls (seductive details).
